text: Hey all, is anybody successfully using `<https://hslocal.net:3000>` for anything? I'm trying the new getting-started-project-theme example but cannot make it past the initial run of `npm run start` . I'm hit with a "This site can't be react / DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN" error
localhost:3000 does show the index page though. I'm going to start my usual troubleshooting process of making sure I have the updated CLI and packages

also worth mentioning that I get this error as well:
```Unexpected error structure: HubSpotHttpError: This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>. ```
but all available scopes are granted (graphQL and HubDB are unavailable for me for this client)

^ related to this but not exactly, in a fresh project when I duplicate the weather template and rename it, it doesn't appear in the "theme templates" grid when creating a new page unless I first click "other templates" (then both appear)
is "content staging" a tiered/paid feature? I no longer see it in the "more tools" dropdown on this new account
last question for today...is there a new way to use Tailwind with the merged projects/theme? seems like in theory I can use it outside of the "app" folder

I'm also seeing
```Skipping /Users/macbook/code/super-green/clients/prism/cms-react/prism-project-theme/src/theme/components/partials/TailwindPartial.jsx due to unsupported extension```
this seems to be happening with all components? maybe Typescript is not set up properly? (I haven't made any changes)
I'm going back to the old version of "themes"â€”unfortunately it looks like this latest version isn't ready yet (but looked very promising)
